speaker: Narrator
line: Guys? There's a somebody I'd like you to meet.

speaker: Narrator
line: 'That' would be Marcel. You wanna say hi?

speaker: Narrator
line: Oh, he is precious! Where did you get him?

speaker: Narrator
line: My friend Bethel rescued him from some lab.

speaker: Narrator
line: That is so cruel! Why? Why would a parent name their child Bethel?

speaker: Narrator
line: Hey, that monkey's got a Ross on its ass!

speaker: Narrator
line: Ross, is he gonna live with you, like, in your apartment?

speaker: Narrator
line: Yeah. I mean, it's been kinda quiet since Carol left, so...

speaker: Narrator
line: Why don't you just get a roommate?

speaker: Narrator
line: Nah, I dunno... I think you reach a certain age, having a roommate is kinda pathe- ....sorry, that's, that's 'pathet', which is Sanskrit for 'really cool way to live'.

speaker: Narrator
line: ...But, you can't actually test this theory, because today's particle accelerators are nowhere near powerful enough to simulate these conditions.

speaker: Narrator
line: Okay, alright, I have a question, then.

speaker: Narrator
line: Um, were you planning on kissing me ever?

speaker: Narrator
line: Uh, that's definitely a, uh, valid question. And, uh, the answer would be yes. Yes I was. But, see, I wanted it to be this phenomenal kiss that happened at this phenomenal moment, because, well, 'cause it's you.

speaker: Narrator
line: Right. But, see, the longer I waited, the more phenomenal the kiss had to be, and now we've reached a place where it's just gotta be one of those things where I just like... sweep everything off the table and throw you down on it. And, uh, I'm not really a, uh, sweeping sorta fella.

speaker: Narrator
line: Oh, David, I, I think you are a sweeping sorta fella. I mean, you're a sweeper! ...trapped inside a physicist's body.

speaker: Narrator
line: Oh, yeah, oh, I'm sure of it. You should just do it, just sweep and throw me.

speaker: Narrator
line: Okay, okay, okay. Y'know what, this was just really expensive. And I'll take- this was a gift.

speaker: Narrator
line: Okay, now you're just kinda tidying.

speaker: Narrator
line: Okay, what the hell, what the hell. You want me to actually throw you or you-you wanna just hop?

speaker: Narrator
line: Um, well, Max told me about Minsk, so congratulations! This is so exciting!

speaker: Narrator
line: It'd be even more exciting if we were going.

speaker: Narrator
line: Oh, you're not going? Oh, why?

speaker: Narrator
line: Tell her, David. 'I don't wanna go to Minsk and work with Lifson and Yamaguchi and Flench, on nonononononono. I wanna stay here and make out with my girlfriend!!'

speaker: Narrator
line: I don't know. I don't know what I'm gonna do. I just- you decide.

speaker: Narrator
line: Oh, but I can't do that-
